}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The Actiontec GT701D is an ADSL2+ router/bridge (1 LAN port) that was commonly used by subscribers to Qwest Telephone's [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qwest] DSL service (USA). It is an early example of an Internet appliance that met the US EPA's [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Environmental_Protection_Agency] requirements for an ENERGY STAR [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Energy_Star] designation [https://www.actiontec.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/GT701D-Datasheet.pdf].
The modem uses the Texas Instruments TNETD7100 system-on-a-chip (SoC) from the AR7 family. This SoC provides bridging or routing, a digital signal processor, the DSL physical layer including a line driver, and the Ethernet physical layer. The AR7 family [https://openwrt.org/docs/techref/hardware/soc/soc.ar7][https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas_Instruments_AR7] are Texas Instruments' designs [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas_Instruments] that first entered service in 2003. The family of designs was sold to Infineon [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infineon_Technologies] in 2007, and the wireline business of Infineon was in turn spun-off in 2009 to form Lantiq [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lantiq]. Lantiq is now part of Intel.
The firmware provided with the modem supports both a web-based interface and telnet log-ins; Telogy's ADAM2 bootloader [https://web.archive.org/save/https://pastebin.com/Lree1Zfg][https://web.archive.org/web/20090406024655/http://oldwiki.openwrt.org/ADAM2.html] (later TI's PSPboot [https://web.archive.org/web/20170701185747/http://www.ti.com/corp/docs/investor_relations/pr_06_02_1999_telogy.html]) allows for firmware updates using FTP.
==Links of Interest== OpenWRT discussion of the Actiontec GT701D [https://openwrt.org/toh/actiontec/gt701d].
OpenWRT discussion of the Texas Instruments AR7 family of systems-on-a-chip [https://openwrt.org/docs/techref/hardware/soc/soc.ar].
OpenWRT discussion of the ADAM2 bootloader and flashing firmware via FTP [https://openwrt.org/docs/techref/bootloader/adam2], which mistakes Texas Instruments' purchase of Telogy for authorship.
A FAQ from DSL Reports for connecting to a GT701D running stock firmware while in bridging mode [https://www.dslreports.com/faq/13743].
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} Actiontec instruction [https://actiontecsupport.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/115001819603/gt701d_firmware_upgrade_instructions.pdf] for flashing new firmware [https://actiontecsupport.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/115001819623/gt701d_ncs_http-upgrade_3.0.4.1.4.img].
===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/actiontec/actiontec_gt701 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/actiontec/gt701d |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 10.03 |current_supported_version = 10.03.1 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts====
pin 1 : GND; pin 2 : TX; pin 3 : RX; pin 4 : NC; pin 5 : 3.3V; pin 6 : NC
